content:
MultiShardCommand MultiShardCommand Class

In this Article

Edit

Complements the MultiShardConnection with a command object similar to the triad of SqlConnection, SqlCommand, and SqlDataReader. The MultiShardCommand takes a T-SQL command statement as its input and executes the command across its collection of shards specified by its corresponding MultiShardConnection. The results from processing the MultiShardCommand are made available through the execute methods and the MultiShardDataReader.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class MultiShardCommand : DbCommand, IComponent, IDbCommand, IDisposablePublic NotInheritable Class MultiShardCommand

    Implements IComponent, IDbCommand, IDisposable

Properties summary

CommandText
CommandText

Gets or sets the command text to execute against the set of shards.
CommandTimeout
CommandTimeout

Time in seconds to wait for the command to be executed on ALL shards. A value of 0 indicates no wait time limit. The default is 300 seconds.
CommandTimeoutPerShard
CommandTimeoutPerShard

This property controls the timeout for running a command against individual shards.
CommandType
CommandType

The CommandTypeof the command to be executed.
Connection
Connection

Gets the current instance of the MultiShardConnection associated with this command.
DbConnection
DbConnection

Connections to shards. Not supported/exposed since connections are managed internally by this instance
DbParameterCollection
DbParameterCollection

Gets the SqlParameter Collection
DbTransaction
DbTransaction

This property is currently not supported. Accessing the property will result in an exception.
DesignTimeVisible
DesignTimeVisible

This property is currently not supported. Accessing the property will result in an exception.
ExecutionOptions
ExecutionOptions

Gets or sets options that control how the command is executed. For instance, you can use this to include the shard name as an additional column into the result.
ExecutionPolicy
ExecutionPolicy

The execution policy to use when executing commands against shards. Through this policy, users can control whether complete results are required, or whether partial results are acceptable.
Parameters
Parameters

The SqlParameterCollection associated with this command.
RetryBehavior
RetryBehavior

The retry behavior for detecting transient faults that could occur when connecting to and executing commands against individual shards.
UpdatedRowSource
UpdatedRowSource

This property is currently not supported. Accessing the property will result in an exception.

Cancel()
Cancel()

Attempts to cancel an in progress MultiShardCommand and any ongoing work that is performed at the shards on behalf of the command.

CreateDbParameter()

Creates an instance of the DbParameter
CreateParameter()
CreateParameter()

Creates a new instance of a SqlParameter object.
Dispose(Boolean)
Dispose(Boolean)

Dispose off any unmanaged/managed resources held
ExecuteDbDataReader(CommandBehavior)
ExecuteDbDataReader(CommandBehavior)
  • Runs the given query against all shards and returns a reader that encompasses results from them.
  • Uses the MultiShardExecutionPolicy.CompleteResults as the default execution policy
  • Includes the $ShardName pseudo column in the results Command behavior to use MultiShardDataReader instance that encompasses results from all shards If the commandText is null or empty If the command behavior is not supported (CloseConnection or SingleResult or SingleRow) If the CommandTimeout elapsed prior to completion
ExecuteDbDataReaderAsync(CommandBehavior, CancellationToken)
ExecuteDbDataReaderAsync(CommandBehavior, CancellationToken)
  • Executes the given query against all shards asynchronously
  • Uses the MultiShardExecutionPolicy.CompleteResults as the default execution policy
  • Includes the $ShardName pseudo column in the results
ExecuteNonQuery()
ExecuteNonQuery()

ExecuteNonQuery is currently not supported
ExecuteNonQueryAsync(CancellationToken)
ExecuteNonQueryAsync(CancellationToken)

ExecuteNonQueryAsync is currently not supported
ExecuteReader()
ExecuteReader()

The ExecuteReader methods of the MultiShardCommand execute the given command statement on each shard and return the concatenation (i.e. UNION ALL) of the individual results from the shards in a MultiShardDataReader. The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.
ExecuteReader(CommandBehavior)
ExecuteReader(CommandBehavior)

Events summary

ShardExecutionBegan
ShardExecutionBegan

The event handler invoked when execution has begun on a given shard.
ShardExecutionCanceled
ShardExecutionCanceled

The event handler invoked when execution on a given shard is canceled, either explicitly via the provided CancellationToken or implicitly as a result of the chosen MultiShardExecutionPolicy.
ShardExecutionFaulted
ShardExecutionFaulted

The event handler invoked when execution on a given shard has faulted. This handler is only invoked on exceptions for which execution could not be retried further as a result of the exception's non-transience or as a result of the chosen RetryBehavior.
ShardExecutionSucceeded
ShardExecutionSucceeded

The event handler invoked when execution has successfully completed on a given shard or its shard-specific IDataReader has been returned.

    ExecuteReader()
    ExecuteReader()

    The ExecuteReader methods of the MultiShardCommand execute the given command statement on each shard and return the concatenation (i.e. UNION ALL) of the individual results from the shards in a MultiShardDataReader. The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.

    public MultiShardDataReader ExecuteReader()Public Function ExecuteReader As MultiShardDataReader

    Returns

    • MultiShardDataReader
      MultiShardDataReader

      the MultiShardDataReader instance with the overall concatenated result set.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException
      InvalidOperationException

      thrown if the commandText is null or empty

    • TimeoutException
      TimeoutException

      thrown if the CommandTimeout elapsed prior to completion

The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.
